A sports enthusiast, eh? I'm happy to help you with that!

Firstly, congratulations on watching some exciting matches recently! The NBA playoffs and the UEFA Champions League final are always thrilling events.

Now, regarding the Premier League schedule, I'd be happy to provide you with an update. The Premier League is the top division of the English football league system, and it's one of the most popular and competitive leagues in the world.

The 2022-23 Premier League season is scheduled to start on August 6, 2022, and will run until May 28, 2023. The exact fixtures and schedules are usually announced a few weeks before the start of the season.

However, I can give you an overview of the key dates and events to look forward to:

1. Opening weekend: August 6-7, 2022
2. International breaks: There will be several international breaks throughout the season, with the first one scheduled for September 19-27, 2022.
3. Derbies and rival matches: Keep an eye out for the Manchester Derby (Manchester City vs. Manchester United), the Merseyside Derby (Liverpool vs. Everton), and the London Derby (Chelsea vs. Tottenham Hotspur), among others.
4. Mid-season break: There will be a winter break in February 2023, with five matches played on the weekend of February 11-12, and the remaining five matches played on February 18-19.
5. Final matchday: The season will conclude on May 28, 2023, with all 10 matches kicking off simultaneously at 4:00 PM BST (British Summer Time).

Please note that the exact fixtures and schedules are subject to change, and I recommend checking the official Premier League website or other reliable sources for the most up-to-date information.
